abstract: The company said it expected its fourth-quarter profit to be at the low end of its previous guidance and warned that charges were likely to top $1 billion after taxes.
snippet: The company said it expected its fourth-quarter profit to be at the low end of its previous guidance and warned that charges were likely to top $1 billion after taxes.
lead_paragraph: General Electric said on Tuesday that it expected its fourth-quarter profit to be at the low end of its previous guidance and warned that charges for restructuring and other items were likely to top $1 billion after taxes.

headline.main: G.E. Warns of Low Fourth-Quarter Profit
headline.print_headline: G.E. Warns of Low Fourth-Quarter Profit
